intro: Pilocarpus selloanus f. brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed wild pepper, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers followed by dark blue, spherical berries. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions with moderate rainfall. This species is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
